Database limitations such as RIO being self-reporting and subjective

convenience sampling through clubs
narrow geographic focus on Spanish context

limitations: Participant was a student in two of the researchers' classes, creating potential obligation bias

https://openalex.org/W2765997898.primary_method: Support Vector Machine (SVM) with Chi-Square feature selection

limitations: Model currently only predicts win/loss, not actual points scored
Approach needs validation on other sports
Future work needed on feature improvement recommendations

limitations: Development of evidence-based classification systems in Paralympic sports require resistant to training measurements, which was not evaluated

Contact mat surface variability on natural turf may impact athlete 'feeling' during acceleration and deceleration

https://openalex.org/W2766530536.main_result: Media narratives surrounding Ricky Williams's marijuana use and retirement constructed him as a selfish black athlete, while more complex understandings of his decision-making and identity were rendered illegible due to the dominance of legible forms of black masculinity in sports discourse.
limitations: Analysis limited to media representations and documentaries, not direct interviews with Williams or other stakeholders
Focus on a single athlete case study limits generalizability
Temporal focus on 2004-2014 may not capture all relevant discourse

https://openalex.org/W2766654087.level_of_analysis: NCAA Division I FBS institution in Southeastern United States; nine women's sports: basketball, golf, rowing, soccer, softball, swimming and diving, tennis, track and field, and volleyball

limitations: All student-athletes from same institution and same division; experiences cannot be generalized to every collegiate female student-athlete
Researcher biases cannot be completely extracted despite bracketing interviews
Sensitive topics in interviews may have affected participant responses

https://openalex.org/W2767468020.main_result: In former NFL players, greater exposure to repetitive head impacts (higher CHII scores) predicted increased volume of white matter signal abnormalities, which in turn predicted worse psychomotor speed and executive function.
limitations: CHII calculated using college-level estimates of head impact frequencies rather than professional-level helmet accelerometer data, thus underestimating RHI exposure

FreeSurfer's labeling of WMSAs tends to be restricted to certain brain regions (e.g., periventricular), so spatial distribution of WMSAs was not examined

https://openalex.org/W2767941402.main_result: Plyometric training added to normal training produced significantly greater improvements in vertical jump (42.26% vs 28.40%), horizontal jump (21.30% vs 13.52%), and agility (11.24% vs 4.74%) performance in the experimental group compared to the control group after 12 months.
limitations: Sample size was small
Few studies in literature on plyometric effects in RG athletes making comparison difficult
Other tests are used to quantify effectiveness of PT intervention, making it difficult to compare findings

https://openalex.org/W2768078938.main_result: A novel global training load measure combining GPS data and perceived wellness was sensitive to match performance, with performance generally highest near the mean load and decreased performance occurring at 1 SD above mean load for several measures across different playing positions.
limitations: Case study design with single team limits generalizability
Effects of load could be contributed by GPS or wellness measures individually rather than combination
Novel calculation method for monotony and strain differs from traditional approach

lack of analysis according to final result of the match or point difference
data validation limited to subsample of five matches

limitations: Small sample size

all_methods: constant confidence interval for proportion of concordance
https://openalex.org/W2769855515.temporal_scope: four months prospective follow-up, plus one retrospective recall week

https://openalex.org/W2769906409.primary_method: magnitude-based inferences with effect size analysis
all_methods: effect size analysis with 90% confidence intervals
t-test (implied by comparison of minutes 5 and 6)
https://openalex.org/W2769906409.main_result: Non-motorized treadmill running requires significantly higher oxygen consumption and heart rate compared to overground and motorized treadmill running at matched speeds, with lighter runners experiencing greater relative intensity increases.
limitations: Relatively homogeneous pool of endurance runners with low body mass may have inflated differences

https://openalex.org/W2770152609.level_of_analysis: Chinese football, FIFA World Cup qualification and hosting

limitations: Risk of soft power backfiring resulting in 'soft disempowerment'

https://openalex.org/W2770162840.level_of_analysis: treadmill running at preferred speed (2.8 ± 0.4 m/s)
https://openalex.org/W2770162840.main_result: Barefoot running showed altered modular organization with motor primitives shifted earlier during stance and later during swing, shorter propulsion duration, and wider arm swing activation compared to shod running.

https://openalex.org/W2770948791.main_result: Physically active and less active retired cricketers demonstrated contrasting attributes regarding key influences on physical activity including time constraints, habit formation, motivation sources, activity preferences, pain management, and cricket coaching engagement.
limitations: Purposive recruitment strategy may have reduced generalisability; retired cricketers reporting uncertainty regarding the impact of cricket on their physical activity level were not invited

https://openalex.org/W2771008566.level_of_analysis: Elite long jump (2016 Paralympic Games and Olympic level)

exploratory study nature

limitations: Small number of participants from one team over one season limiting generalizability
Missing data from 4 of 14 players who did not wear microsensor regularly
18.8% of integrated load data was estimated rather than directly measured

https://openalex.org/W4200088632.primary_method: multifactor ANOVA analysis using F test

limitations: Study included only subjects aged 7 to 14 years, extending to other age groups would help identify particular issues

Challenges with pre-activated motionless rest measurements affected by EPOC

limitations: Further research with focusing on other sport skills and different biomechanical constraints are needed

Different studies show inconsistent results regarding animated versus real model advantages

https://openalex.org/W4200233803.primary_method: One-way repeated measures analysis of variance

https://openalex.org/W4408498257.level_of_analysis: Professional road cyclists, UCI Pro Team members

https://openalex.org/W4408557862.level_of_analysis: National Basketball Association (NBA), 2009-2024 regular seasons, all 30 franchises

limitations: Manual data collection of analytics staff headcounts from NBAStuffer introduces potential measurement error and risk of nonrandom error if certain teams conceal staff directories or if NBAStuffer systematically underestimates certain organizations

Cannot account for day-to-day fluctuations in player fatigue, team morale, or on-court playing conditions which all impact team performance
Assumption of independence (A2) is necessarily violated because winning is a zero-sum outcome, though authors argue the effect is minimal with 30 teams

https://openalex.org/W4414917266.main_result: Model 3 (markers at L1, L3, and L5) demonstrates strong correlation with Model 4 (all lumbar vertebrae) with Pearson coefficients approaching 1.0, supporting the use of a two-segment lumbar spine representation for flexion-extension kinematic analysis in acrobatic athletes.

sample size may reduce statistical sensitivity to detect subtle differences between groups

sample consisted entirely of amateur runners, limiting generalizability to other populations

https://openalex.org/W4415101164.primary_method: linear regression models with coefficient of determination, root mean square error, and mean absolute percentage error

https://openalex.org/W4415213466.level_of_analysis: International professional cycling races including one-day and stage races from 2017-2023
https://openalex.org/W4415213466.main_result: Six distinct technical stage clusters were identified via K-means clustering, with relative elevation per kilometer (β = 0.42, p < 0.001) being the strongest predictor of performance variability (coefficient of variation), followed by unpaved percentage (β = 0.23, p < 0.01), distance (β = 0.18, p < 0.05), and vertical gain (β = 0.11, p < 0.05); more technically demanding stages showed higher CV values reflecting greater tactical fragmentation and fatigue.

https://openalex.org/W4415237406.temporal_scope: fourth week of the pre-season preparation phase

https://openalex.org/W4415256155.level_of_analysis: PGA Tour professional golf 2021-22 through 2024 seasons

https://openalex.org/W4415272698.main_result: Runners with lower decoupling (greater durability) exhibited distinct changes in speed-adjusted step frequency and step length, with increased step frequency and decreased step length throughout the marathon, while biomechanical deterioration in high decoupling runners disappeared after speed adjustment.

https://openalex.org/W4415303092.primary_method: functional logistic regression with functional principal component analysis (FPCA)

https://openalex.org/W4415371943.main_result: A significant negative correlation exists between carbohydrate adequacy level and body fat percentage in adolescent football athletes (r = -0.4853, p = 0.0042), while protein and fat adequacy levels show no significant correlation with body fat percentage.

https://openalex.org/W4415427056.primary_method: Rough Pythagorean Fuzzy Dombi Weighted Averaging (RPyFDWA) operator with PROMETHEE

https://openalex.org/W4415457580.level_of_analysis: track-and-field events including 10 running events, 4 jumping events, and 4 throwing events; youth athletes (5-19 years), senior athletes (20-34 years), and masters athletes (35-100 years)
